  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATLEY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING PIZZA. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX.

item.title: Report E-2023100912
item.description:
Report E-2023100912

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-06T09:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-19
  • City: MATTESON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 19, 2023, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN2014 was damaged in transit and released approximately 275-gallons of product to the trailer floor and concrete beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews utilized hand tools to collect and containerize all free-standing product and previously deployed absorbents from the trailer floor into five (5) 55-gallon open top drums. HCE personnel utilized a forklift to perform a gravity transfer of the remaining UN2014 in the tote into one (1) additional 55-gallon open top drum. All UN2014-impacted materials were collected and containerized into one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal. The impacted wood pallets were staged on site along with the seven (7) previously generated 55-gallon drums for further management.

item.title: Report X-2023100578
item.description:
Report X-2023100578

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-29
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found on the Overgoods table after being attempted to be repacked by another Admin. Package came from Facility 608 (South Chicago). Package begun leaking again and was determined to be damaged. Package had Flammable Liquid labeling and was determined to be a Fully Regulated HazMat. Package was then taken off the warehouse floor and was isolated from the rest of the staff. DescribePack: 1 of the 6 jerrican containers inside was badly abraded at its bottom and was punctured. This led to a leak of hazardous materials out of a small hole in the bottom of the container. 2 of the other containers were also badly bent but did not begin to leak. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was taken to the HazMat Cage for isolation and processing.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was discovered on the OTP sort and placed in front of the cage. Further inspection of package confirmed it was being returned to the shipper due to being an improper shipment. During transit back to the shipper the package became damaged and damaged the inside can contents. Flammable liquid DescribePack: dented corners of the cans cause release due to bends created in aluminum. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in tote and under hood

  • Description: DURING CLEAN UP AND INSPECTION RESPONDER DISCOVERED PACKAGE CONTAINED 4 1 GAL PLASTIC BOTTLES OF VANQUISH IN WHICH 1 LEAKED AT THE CLOSURE. THE REMAINING BOTTLES GOT WET SO ENTIRE CONTENTS GOT PROCESSED THRU DMP.
